reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Strengthen support to communities towards the Elimination of Malaria, TB & HIV/AIDS in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Sierra Leone - Multicomponent - Catholic Relief Services - United States Conference of Catholic Bishops - CRS Sierra Leone. This program has the following goals: Reduce new HIV infections and AIDS related mortality. Reduce the incidence of Tuberculosis in Sierra Leone by 30% by 2025 (from 298 per 100,000 to 210 per 100,000). By end of 2025, contribute significantly to the improvement of the well-being of the population by reducing the malaria burden. Reorganize and strengthen the entire public and private health systems to ensure access to quality and affordable health care for all Sierra Leoneans by 2030. The objectives of this program are: Strengthening HIV combination prevention among general, key and vulnerable populations. Increasing access to and retention in HIV treatment, care and support for the PLHIV, key and highly vulnerable populations.. Strengthening the critical HIV response enablers and multisectoral development synergies.. TB case detection rate is increased by 15% through active case finding, integration of TB in other services, involvement of Private sector, and expansion of use of Gene-Xpert test, and 90% of Drug Susceptible TB cases notified & treated by 2025.. To increase treatment success rate of TB (all forms) from 88.9% in 2019 to 90% in 2025.. To detect and diagnose 90% of the MDR-TB cases and treat with appropriate therapy by 2025. To test all TB patients for HIV and ensure all(100%) co- infected patients enrolled on ART.. By end of 2025, (i) reduce malaria mortality rates by at least 75% compared to 2015; (ii) reduce malaria case incidence by at least 75% compared to 2015; and (iii) 90% of the population practice at least 3 recommended malaria prevention and control behaviours. By 2025, (iv) strengthen malaria surveillance and use of malaria information to improve decision making for programme performance; (v) Ensure timely and adequate supply of quality-assured malaria commodities to public and private health facilities at all levels;. By 20205, (vi) strengthen and maintain capacity for program management, coordination and partnership to achieve malaria programme performance at all levels; and, (vii) improve mobilisation of resources and maximise the efficient use of available resource for greater public health impact.. Transform the health sector from an under-resourced, ill-equipped and inadequate delivery system into a well-resourced and functioning national health-care delivery system that is affordable for everyone and accessible to all especially the most vulnerable segment of the population.

title.narrative: Impact indicator for SLE-Z-CRS
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
Reported malaria cases (presumed and confirmed)
Confirmed malaria cases (microscopy or RDT): rate per 1000 persons per year
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
Percentage of people who inject drugs who are living with HIV
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Inpatient malaria deaths per year: rate per 100,000 persons per year
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Malaria test positivity rate
Malaria parasite prevalence: Proportion of children aged 6-59 months with malaria infection
Coverage / Output indicator for SLE-Z-CRS
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Outcome indicator for SLE-Z-CRS
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a non regular partner
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percentage of people living with HIV who report experiences of HIV-related discrimination in health-care settings
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Notification of RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases – Percentage of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed, drug resistant RR-TB and/or MDR-TB as a proportion of all estimated RR-TB and/or MDR-TB cases
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
Percentage of people who inject drugs reporting the use of sterile injecting equipment the last time they injected
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Proportion of population with access to an ITN within their household
Proportion of population that slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of children under five years old who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
Proportion of population using an insecticide-treated net among those with access to an insecticide-treated net
Proportion of pregnant women who slept under an insecticide-treated net the previous night
